author: JuliaRegistrator

comments.body:
Your `new package` pull request does not meet the guidelines for auto-merging. Please make sure that you have read the [General registry README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md). The following guidelines were not met:

- Name does not meet all of the following: starts with an uppercase letter, ASCII alphanumerics only, not all letters are uppercase.
- Name is not at least five characters long
- Package name similar to 11 existing packages.
<details>
<summary>Similar package names</summary>

1. Similar to WCS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 2.15 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
2. Similar to XDF. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2. Normalized visual distance 2.44 is at or below cutoff of 2.50.
3. Similar to SCS. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
4. Similar to XPA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
5. Similar to ECC. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
6. Similar to GCP. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
7. Similar to XAM. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
8. Similar to FCA. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
9. Similar to FIB. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
10. Similar to TCX. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
11. Similar to XKCD. Damerau-Levenshtein distance 2 is at or below cutoff of 2.
</details>


Note that the guidelines are only required for the pull request to be merged automatically. However, it is **strongly recommended** to follow them, since otherwise the pull request needs to be manually reviewed and merged by a human.

Since you are registering a new package, please make sure that you have also read the package naming guidelines: https://julialang.github.io/Pkg.jl/dev/creating-packages/#Package-naming-guidelines-1



---
If you want to prevent this pull request from being auto-merged, simply leave a comment. If you want to post a comment without blocking auto-merging, you must include the text `[noblock]` in your comment.
<!-- [noblock] -->
<!---
this_is_the_single_automerge_comment
--->
We'd like to keep the name XCB.jl if possible, since it wraps the library of the same name. The compat entries were also updated.

> The compat entries were also updated.

Automerge doesn't think so and [this file](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/0fa5d146ebc1b57e1a1db09de766aa0c3a5938f3/X/XCB/Compat.toml) doesn't have any entry for `CEnum`.  You need to retrigger registration (without changing the version number) so that this pull request is updated

Oh, my bad, I indeed need to retrigger registration. I can't manage to do it though. I tried [here](https://github.com/JuliaGL/XCB.jl/issues/7) (last comment) and [there](https://github.com/JuliaGL/XCB.jl/issues/10), without success.

The instructions from the [README](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/blob/master/README.md) say
> How do I retrigger Registrator in order to update my pull request?
> 
> Do what you did when you triggered Registrator the first time.

and this is what I did, am I doing something wrong?
JuliaRegistrator has been down yesterday and until a couple of hours ago.  Try again
